data.title: Top 20 best black male pop singers you need to know in 2024
data.meta_description: Who are some of the BLACK MALE POP SINGERS? Check out this list of some of of the prominent names making it big in the music industry, age is just a number
data.text:
Pop music is one of those genres where the song is more than just the vocalist or the music video; it's a reflection of a singular passion for a certain rhythm. The music, which was made popular by black performers, takes you on a fantastic trip. So who are the best black male pop singers in 2024?

The new period of male pop musicians like John Legend and Chris Brown is known for producing great music. These black male pop singers have added twists to pop music and they are making it even better. Who are the best black singers and what are they known for?

Best black male pop singers

Who are some of the best male pop singers? Several artists have worked hard to get to where they are now, with some of them being younger than 26 years old and according to The Famous People, the following are some of the best male pop singers.

1. Chris Brown

Full name: Christopher Maurice Brown

Date of birth: May 5, 1989

Place of birth: Tappahannock, Virginia, U.S.

Age: 32 years

Profession: Singer

Chris Brown is a singer, songwriter and dancer. His versatility has made him one of the greatest of all time. He rose to fame in 2005 after his song, Run It, won first place on the American Billboard charts.

2. The Weeknd

Full name: Abel Makkonen Tesfaye

Date of birth: February 16, 1990

Place of birth: Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Age: 32 years

Profession: Singer

The Weeknd was born in Canada, and he leapt into the music business thanks to rapper Drake. His famous songs include Starboy, Can't Feel My Face, and I Feel It Coming.

3. Khalid

Full name: Khalid Donnel Robinson

Date of birth: February 11, 1998

Place of birth: Fort Stewart, Georgia, United States

Age: 24 years

Profession: Singer

One of the young black male singers is Khalid, a fast-rising young star. At only 24 years old, the singer has won many awards. He's originally from Fort Stewart but later moved to New York. His song Location was released in 2016, making him famous and since then, his singles have been winning awards.

4. John Legend

Full name: John Roger Stephens

Date of birth: December 28, 1978

Place of birth: Springfield, Ohio, United States

Age: 43 years

Profession: Singer

John Legend is a singer, film director, theatre director and songwriter. His song All Of Me from his fourth album was number one on Billboard's top 100. His other songs have been successful, and for that, he has won a handful of Grammys.

5. Trey Songz

Full name: Tremaine Aldon Neverson

Date of birth: November 28, 1984

Place of birth: Petersburg, Virginia, United States

Age: 37 years

Profession: Singer

Trey Songz was awarded the best male RnB artist in the BET awards in 2010. He made his debut in the music scene in 2005 after releasing his song I Gotta Make It. The song reached number 20 in the Billboard awards and was sold over 300,000 times. He had 8 albums by 2020, and most of his singles were topping charts.

6. Bryson Tiller

Full name: Bryson Djuan Tiller

Date of birth: January 2, 1993

Place of birth: Louisville, Kentucky, United States

Age: 29 years

Profession: Singer

Due to his love for hip-hop, Bryson refers to himself as Trap soul. He has received support from several artists throughout his career, including Timbaland and Drake, which made his music to be received well by his fans. He has three albums, his latest one being the one he released last year.

7. 6lack

Full name: Ricardo Valdez Valentine Jr.

Date of birth: June 24, 1992

Place of birth: Baltimore, Maryland, United States

Age: 29 years

Profession: Singer

Pronounced as 'Black'. The singer started recording music at 4 in his father's studio. His first album, Free 6lack, was released in 2016, and it peaked at number 34 on the Billboard charts top 200.

9. Miguel

Full name: Miguel Jontel Pimentel

Date of birth: October 23, 1985

Place of birth: San Pedro, California, United States

Age: 36 years

Profession: Singer

American R&B singer, songwriter, and producer Miguel hails from the San Pedro district of Los Angeles, where many Americans of Mexican descent live. He signed his first music deal at 14, which he terminated again at 18. After that, Miguel went into contract with an indie label for two years but released no music.

10. Jacquees

Full name: Rodriquez Jacquees Broadnax

Date of birth: April 15, 1994

Place of birth: Decatur, Georgia, United States

Age: 27 years

Profession: Singer

Jacquees is a singer and a songwriter. He has made a name for himself thanks to the excellent music he releases now and then. Jacquees has been a force in the music scene ever since he released his first album, 4275.

11. Pink Sweat$

Full name: David Bowden

Date of birth: February 14, 1992

Place of birth: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, U.S.

Age: 30 years

Profession: Singer

After the attire, he became known for wearing sweatpants in the studio. R&B singer and songwriter Pink Sweat$ is widely known for only using his voice and just a guitar. He joined the music industry in 2018.

12. Partynextdoor

Full name: Jahron Anthony Brathwaite,

Date of birth: July 3, 1993

Place of birth: Mississauga, Canada

Age: 28 years

Profession: Singer

Partynextdoor started his career in 2013 after dropping his first mixtape, which made it to number 6 on Billboard Heatseekers Album charts and sold 2000 copies. Additionally, it was number 34 on the Top RnB chart. He released his first single, Make A Mil, after being signed to rapper drake's record label, OVO.

13. Brent Faiyaz

Full name: Christopher Brent Wood

Date of birth: September 19, 1995

Place of birth: Columbia, Maryland, United States

Age: 26 years

Profession: Singer

Brent Faiyaz is a Maryland pop RnB star who started his career as a rapper. He came into the limelight after releasing his first single, Crew, alongside other artists like Shy Glizzy and GoldLink. Crew was nominated for the 2018 Grammy Awards. He has gotten inspiration from singers and rappers like Lil Wayne, Drake and Curren$y and his style is versatile.

14. YK Osiris

Full name: Osiris Jahkail Williams

Date of birth: September 7, 1998

Place of birth: Jacksonville, Florida.

Age: 23 years

Profession: Singer

After releasing a few of his songs online, YK OSIRIS was discovered by the higher ranks of the music industry and signed with Def Jam Recordings in 2019. The 23-year-old pop star came into the spotlight at the age of 18.

15. Vedo

Full name: Vedo

Date of birth: February 25, 1993

Place of birth: Benton Harbor, Michigan

Age: 54 years

Profession: Actress

Vedo began his career as a YouTuber and appeared on NBC's The Voice before fast transitioning into a professional recording artist and one of the top male R&B singers. Vedo's breakthrough has come a long time, with popular singles including You Got It and other albums released since 2015.

16. Luh Kel

Full name: Turran Coleman

Date of birth: May 20, 2002

Place of birth: St. Louis, Missouri, U.S.

Age: 20 years

Profession: Singer

Luh Kel, a St. Louis native, is the list's quickest emerging pop star. While Luh Kel's sound is comparable to that of the current wave of melodic rappers, most of his songs are about the feelings and love that have helped shape the rhythm and blues genre.

17. Eric Bellinger

Full name: Eric Aldwin Bellinger,

Date of birth: March 26, 1986

Place of birth: Los Angeles, California, United States

Age: 36 years

Profession: Singer

Eric Bellinger is known for being the guy behind the scenes of some of your favourite tracks as a great songwriter and being a talented performer. While his singing career does not compare to his songwriting achievements, Bellinger has released several popular songs since the mid-2010s.

18. Roy Woods

Full name: Denzel Spencer,

Date of birth: April 18, 1996

Place of birth: Brampton, Canada

Age: 25 years

Profession: Singer

Roy Woods' debut album, Drama, Get You Good, and Jealousy, was a perfect masterpiece when he first debuted in the music industry in 2015.

Black male pop singers of the '90s

With the rise of artists like Micheal Jackson, Jodeci, Guy, and a host of other solo artists, 90s pop delivered some outstanding music to the radio and the globe. So who are some of the black male pop singers at the time?

19. Prince

Full name: Prince Rogers Nelson

Date of birth: June 7, 1958

Place of birth: Minneapolis, Minnesota

Died: April 21 2016, Paisley Park, Chanhassen, Minnesota, United States

Age: 58 years

Profession: Singer

Prince is a singer-songwriter, dancer, and musician primarily regarded as one of his generation's finest musicians. He was a superb guitarist who could also play various instruments. He is one of the best-selling music artists, with over 150 million albums sold worldwide. He was also noted for his outgoing personality.

20. Micheal Jackson

Full name: Michael Joseph Jackson

Date of birth: August 29 1958

Place of birth: Gary, Indiana, United States

Died: June 25 2009, Holmby Hills, Los Angeles, California, United States

Age: 51years

Profession: Singer

Michael Jackson, the King of Pop and an international phenomenon, was a musical entertainer whose work – both with the Jackson 5 and alone – gained acclaim and hearts worldwide. His distinctive dancing moves were equally popular, causing a stir and influencing subsequent dance genres.

Which of the contemporary black male pop singers do you like most to see perform live, and which albums are you presently listening to? Be on the lookout for new songs by these artists and don't forget to check out this year's top new pop songs.

Tuko.co.ke published an article on the world's top rappers right now. There are a variety of criteria used to determine who is the greatest in the field. However, societal influence and mic skills are important considerations. So, who are the top rappers on the planet right now? Tupac Shakur, who died in 1996, is still regarded as one of the best rappers of all time.

Source: TUKO.co.ke
